Text: PLAN B: Schumer Introduces Legislation to ëMake Sure We Never Have Another ShutdowníSen. Minority Leader Chuck Schumer introduced legislation over the weekend that would effectively ban potential government shutdowns in the near future; saying a Democrat proposal would ìmake sure we never have another shutdown again.îChuck Schumer: "I am announcing today that I am supporting legislation that will make sure we never have another shutdown again." pic.twitter.com/F4ZcpmtQ5Có The Hill (@thehill) January 28, 2019ìI am announcing today that Iím supporting legislation that will make sure we never have another shutdown again. And if the President and Congress canít reach an agreement, federal workers are still paid at the levels they have always been paid,î said Schumer.ìWe can pass that legislation, it will mean above all that federal workers will not be hurt again and will also eliminate the incentive for anyone to use the shutdown as a tool to get what they want,î he added.Watch Schumerís comments above.

WHO CARES? Speaker Pelosi Bizarrely Claims State of the Union ëUnimportantí for Most AmericansSpeaker of the House Nancy Pelosi bizarrely slammed the Presidentís annual State of the Union Address Thursday; saying the Commander-in-Chiefís national speech is largely ìunimportantî for average Americans.ìLast night the president accepted the fact that the State of the Union should be at a time when government is not shut down. Iím glad we could get that off the table. It is so unimportant in the lives of the American people in terms of especially those who are victims of the shutdown, hostages to the presidentís applause line in a campaign speech,î Pelosi said during her weekly press briefing.Nancy Pelosi says Pres. Trump "accepted the fact" that State of the Union won't be held until after shutdown."I'm glad we could get that off the tableÖIt is so unimportant in the lives of the American people, especially those who are victims of the shutdown." pic.twitter.com/UqEilv7gy3ó ABC News Politics (@ABCPolitics) January 24, 2019ìThank goodness we have put that matter to rest and we can get on to the subject at hand, open up government so we can negotiate how best to protect our borders,î she added.

DEMS CAVING? Centrist Democrats Urge Pelosi to Strike a Deal with Trump on BorderSeveral centrist Democrats called on Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi to make a counteroffer to President Trumpís immigration compromise proposal; saying the left-wing leader needs to end the partial government shutdown.The group of moderate lawmakers urged Pelosi to schedule a full vote on the presidentís border wall proposal in February should they vote to re-open the government.ìWe understand that this shutdown was not caused by the 116th Congress, but it is our job to fix it,î said a statement from the group.ìWe promised our constituents that we would seek bipartisan solutions, and we feel that this proposal would gain bipartisan support and allow a transparent process to evaluate the true needs of border security and provide much-needed reform to our immigration process,î added the letter.Over the weekend, the President unveiled his immigration compromise; saying he was prepared to extend DACA protections to the nationís ëDreamersí in exchange for $5.7 billion in border wall funding.Read the full report at Politico.

WEEK 5: Trump Praises ëPatrioticí Federal Workers Going ëWithout Payí During ShutdownPresident Trump thanked ìpatrioticî federal employees Sunday evening as the partial government shutdown entered its fifth week; saying Republicans and Democrats must work together to solve the nationís escalating border crisis.ìTo all of the great people who are working so hard for your Country and not getting paid I say, THANK YOU ñ YOU ARE GREAT PATRIOTS! We must now work together, after decades of abuse, to finally fix the Humanitarian, Criminal & Drug Crisis at our Border. WE WILL WIN BIG!î Trump tweeted on social media.To all of the great people who are working so hard for your Country and not getting paid I say, THANK YOU ñ YOU ARE GREAT PATRIOTS! We must now work together, after decades of abuse, to finally fix the Humanitarian, Criminal & Drug Crisis at our Border. WE WILL WIN BIG!ó Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 21, 2019The Presidentís comments come hours after he offered a compromise immigration package to Congressional Democrats; agreeing to extend DACA protections in exchange for $5.7 billion in border wall funding.†

DEMS DENIED! White House Says Congress Canít Use ëGovernment Aircraftí During ShutdownA letter released from the Office of Budget Management Friday confirmed members of Congress are prohibited from using ìgovernment aircraftî during a federal shutdown; saying all legislators and their staff need ìWhite House approvalî for air travel.ìIn light of the current partial government shutdown, the President has asked me to direct the heads of all executive departments and agencies of the Administration on new policies in support of Legislative Branch travel,î reads the statement.Looks like Pelosi travels heavy https://t.co/i2yDUCld1Wó Mark R. Levin (@marklevinshow) January 18, 2019ìUnder no circumstances during a government shutdown will any government owned, rented, leased, or chartered aircraft support any Congressional delegation, without the express written approval of the White House Chief of Staff,î adds the letter.The statement comes hours after President Trump abruptly canceled Speaker Pelosiís overseas trip; demanding the Democratic leader remain in Washington and re-open the federal government.Read the full statement here.

HANNITY: Pelosiís ëIntercontinental Tripí Shows Sheís Not Serious About Gov ShutdownSpeaking during his opening monologue on ëHannityí Thursday night, Sean slammed Speaker Pelosiís ìpostponedî international trip in the midst of a partial government shutdown; saying the liberal leader was playing petty political games.ìIn the middle of a partial government shutdown, Speaker Nancy Pelosi was all set to leave on a military plane, on your dime, and embark on a seven-day excursion with other Democratic members of Congress,î said Hannity.ìThatís until President Trump pulled the plugÖ Keep in mind this letter comes 24-hours after Speaker Pelosi called for the State of the Union to be canceled. She was perfectly happy to take a government-funded intercontinental trip instead of staying in Washington, DC and doing her job,î he added.Watch Hannityís opening monologue above.

GREAT QUESTION: Trump Asks Why Pelosi is Still 'Getting Paid' During Gov ShutdownPresident Trump took his war-of-words with Speaker Nancy Pelosi to the next level Tuesday; asking why the Democratic leader continues to receive her government salary as thousands of federal workers go without pay.ìWhy is Nancy Pelosi getting paid when people who are working are not?î pondered the president on social media.Why is Nancy Pelosi getting paid when people who are working are not?ó Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 15, 2019Pelosi and House Democrats found themselves in hot-water with American workers over the weekend; jetting to a tropical retreat in Puerto Rico as thousands went without pay throughout the country.

BAD VACATION: Trump Slams Top Democrats for ëCelebrating Shutdowní in Puerto RicoPresident Trump didnít mince words when commenting on the Democratsí recent trip to Puerto Rico Monday; saying he was in the nationís capital ìall weekendî while liberal lawmakers were ìcelebratingî the shutdown on a tropical beach.President Trump: "I've been here all weekend. A lot of the Democrats were in Puerto Rico celebrating something. I don't know. Maybe they're celebrating the #shutdown." pic.twitter.com/iZoixGG0Roó CSPAN (@cspan) January 14, 2019ìIíve been here all weekend. A lot of the Democrats were in Puerto Rico celebrating something. I donít know, maybe theyíre celebrating the shutdown. We have a very big crisis on the border. Everybody knows it, they know it,î said the president.ìThe Republicans are rock solid, weíve got to take care of our border. Many of the people that arenít being paid right now are in total agreement with us,î he added.Watch the Presidentís comments above.

SARAH SMACKDOWN: Huckabee Sanders ROASTS Democrats for ëBeach Vacationí During ShutdownWhite House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders unloaded on congressional Democrats over the weekend; blasting the left-wing lawmakers for ìpartying on the beachî as the federal government shutdown entered its fourth week.ìDemocrats in Congress are so alarmed about federal workers not getting paid theyíre partying on the beach instead of negotiating a compromise to reopen the government and secure the border,î she posted on social media.Democrats in Congress are so alarmed about federal workers not getting paid theyíre partying on the beach instead of negotiating a compromise to reopen the government and secure the borderhttps://t.co/zpJypJ2Slqó Sarah Sanders (@PressSec) January 13, 2019Sandersí comments come hours after approximately 30 Democratic members chartered a jet and flew to Puerto Rico to take part in the annual Congressional Hispanic Caucus BOLD PAC gathering.Read the full report at Fox News.

PELOSI: Shutdown Vacation OK Because ëHawaii is a Part of the United StatesíCalifornia congresswoman and likely Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi defended her tropical vacation during the government shutdown this week; saying her Christmas trip was appropriate because Hawaii is technically a part of the United States.Pelosi was speaking with NBC News when she was asked to comment on President Trumpís ìswipeî about her taking a lavish holiday trip while thousands of federal workers went without pay throughout the country.Nancy Pelosi Defends Vacation During Shutdown: Trump May Not Know 'Hawaii is Part of the United Statesí https://t.co/IiO5LDzEN7 pic.twitter.com/LLd4T0akbEó Mediaite (@Mediaite) January 3, 2019ìI observed the Christmas holiday for a few daysÖ and in fact cut in half the time I would have had with my family. Itís totally unimportant. The fact is we all stood ready and told our members we have 24 hoursí notice to be where we need to be,î said Pelosi.ìThe President may not know this, but Hawaii is part of the United States of America. Maybe he doesnít realize that,î she added.

NASTY IN NY: De Blasio Slams ëSadí Shutdown, Says NYC Will ëContinue to FunctioníNew York City Mayor Bill de Blasio weighed-in Monday on the federal governmentís partial shutdown over border security; calling the development a ìsad moment for Americaî but reassuring Big Apple residents their ìcity governmentî will ìcontinue to function.îì[President Trumpís] shutdown is a sad moment for America. But I can assure the people of New York City that their city government will continue to function,î posted de Blasio on social media..@realDonaldTrumpís shutdown is a sad moment for America. But I can assure the people of New York City that their city government will continue to function. pic.twitter.com/Lsl2inOTlró Mayor Bill de Blasio (@NYCMayor) December 24, 2018De Blasioís comments come just weeks after a mild, seasonally average snowstorm brought the nationís largest city to a total standstill; with residents calling for the mayor to resign after countless New Yorkers were stuck in snarled traffic for upwards of seven hours.

FINAL WARNING: Trump Tells Dems He's ëTOTALLY PREPAREDí for a ëVery Long ShutdowníPresident Trump warned Congressional leaders Friday that the White House was ìtotally preparedî for a ìvery long shutdownî should they fail to reach a budget deal; saying this may be ìour only chanceî to get ìgreat border security.îThe President was speaking with reporters during a signing ceremony for his Criminal Reform Justice Bill when he weighed-in on the potential shutdown as the Friday deadline loomed closer."We're totally prepared for a very long shutdown," Pres. Trump says. "This is our only chance that we'll ever haveÖto get great border security."https://t.co/W46TRJrB0j pic.twitter.com/8w9zTItHOGó ABC News (@ABC) December 21, 2018ìNow itís up to the Democrats as to whether or not we have a shutdown tonight. I hope we donít, but weíre totally prepared for a very long shutdown. This is our only chance that weíll ever have because of the world and the way it works out, to get great border security,î said the president.

SHUTDOWN DELAYED? McConnell Says US Needs ëGovernment to Remain OpeníThe US Senate plans to introduce a short-term spending bill to keep the federal government open for business Wednesday; delaying a full budget vote until February 8th as legislators struggle to reach an agreement surrounding border security.ìThe bill would fund the government through Feb. 8, Senate Majority Leader†Mitch McConnell†announced. The Senate will take up the measure later Wednesday, the Kentucky Republican said.†Lawmakers need to pass spending bills by midnight Friday to avoid a partial shutdown,î writes CNBC.ìWe need the government to remain open for the American people,î McConnell†told his fellow lawmakers.ìA White House spokesman did not immediately respond to a request to comment on whether Trump would back a short-term spending bill. On Tuesday, White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders said the president would want to see what Congress passes before he decides whether to sign it,î adds the article.Read the full story at CNBC.

TICK TOCK: Shutdown Looms as Democrats ëDig Iní Against Border Wall FundingThe federal government hurled towards another potential shut-down Tuesday morning, with congressional Democrats refusing to fund President Trumpís signature campaign promise: a physical wall along the US-Mexico border.ìPresident Trump and congressional Democrats remain sharply at odds over a spending package as Washington barrels toward a Friday at midnight deadline, leaving some on Capitol Hill increasingly worried that a Christmas government shutdown is in the making,î writes Fox News.President Trump slammed those opposed to the ëBorder Wallí on social media Tuesday morning, posting ìIllegal immigration costs the United States more than 200 Billion Dollars a year. How was this allowed to happen?îIllegal immigration costs the United States more than 200 Billion Dollars a year. How was this allowed to happen?ó Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) December 18, 2018Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer refused to budge on his partyís hardline against securing the southern border, saying ìSo everyone knows the situation: even with a Republican Congress, no threat or temper tantrum will get the president his wall.î

WATCH LIVE: President Trump Addresses the Nation Regarding Government ShutdownWatch live as President Trump addresses the nation from the White House regarding the ongoing government shutdown Friday afternoon. The Commander-in-Chiefís comments come as the budget stalemate finishes its fifth week; becoming the longest shutdown in US history.Watch the Presidentís comments live below:

ëLET ME BE CLEARí: Trump Demands 'Fair Deal' by Feb 15th, Another Shutdown, or 'EmergencyíPresident Trump officially ended the 35-day long government shutdown Friday; unveiling a deal that re-opens the federal government for three weeks while both parties forge a bipartisan border agreement.The President addressed the nation from the White House lawn, where he warned Congressional leaders to ìget a fair dealî by February 15th or he will declare a national emergency along the US-Mexico border.. @realDonaldTrump : "So let me be very clearÖIf we don't get a fair deal from congress, the government either shutdown on February 15th again or I will use the powers afforded to me under the laws, and the constitution of the United States, to address this emergency." pic.twitter.com/1rqvmmnKp8ó Washington Examiner (@dcexaminer) January 25, 2019ìSo let me be very clearÖIf we donít get a fair deal from congress, the government either shutdown on February 15th again or I will use the powers afforded to me under the laws, and the constitution of the United States, to address this emergency.î

YOUíRE GROUNDED: Trump Tells Pelosi to ëFly Commercialí During Government ShutdownPresident Trump abruptly canceled Speaker Nancy Pelosiís foreign visit Thursday; instructing the leading Democrat to ìfly commercialî should she choose to travel overseas.ìObviously, if you would like to make your journey by flying commercial, that would certainly be your prerogative,î said the presidentís statement.President @realDonaldTrumpís letter to @SpeakerPelosi concerning her upcoming travel pic.twitter.com/TtBCvwp080ó Sarah Sanders (@PressSec) January 17, 2019ìI look forward to seeing you soon and even more forward to watching our open and dangerous southern border finally receive the attention, funding, and security it so desperately deserves,î he added.

BREAKING: Trump, Dems Agree to ëRe-Opení Gov for Three Weeks, Create ëBorder Security' PanelPresident Trump and Congressional leaders have agreed to re-open the federal government for three weeks; paving a path forward for a bipartisan border security panel to craft a comprehensive solution.ìThe deal [Ö] wouldnít provide immediate funding for a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border, administration officials said. The deal would fund the government through Feb. 15 and start negotiations between the House and Senate over a full-year bill funding the Homeland Security Department, which oversees the border, aides said,î writes the Wall Street Journal.ìI am very proud to announce we have reached a deal to end the shutdown and reopen the federal government,î said the President at the White House.The proposed legislation would immediately provide an extension of border security funding at the current level, which features $1.3 billion for protecting the nationís southern border.This is a developing story. Check back for updates.

NANCY DENIED! President Trump Seizes Pelosiís Aircraft, Cancels ëForeign Tripí Over ShutdownPresident Trump abruptly ìpostponedî Speaker Nancy Pelosiís planned foreign trip Thursday; saying he was ìsorry to informî the left-wing leader that her overseas excursion would be ìrescheduledî over the government shutdown.ìPresident Trump on Thursday appeared to deny military aircraft to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for a foreign trip just minutes before the congressional delegation was set to depart, in a stunning response to her call to delay the State of the Union address amid the government shutdown,î writes Fox News.ìDue to the Shutdown, I am sorry to inform you that your trip to Brussels, Egypt, and Afghanistan has been postponed. We will reschedule this seven-day excursion when the Shutdown is over. In light of the 800,000 great American workers not receiving pay, I am sure you would agree that postponing this public relations event is totally appropriate,î Trump wrote in a letter to Pelosi.ìI also feel that, during this period, it would be better if you were in Washington negotiating with me and joining the Strong Border Security movement to end the Shutdown. Obviously, if you would like to make your journey by flying commercial, that would certainly be your prerogative,î he added.Read the full report at Fox News.

LINDSEY GRAHAM: Declare National Emergency if Democrats Say ëGo to Hellí on Border WallSen. Lindsey Graham weighed-in Friday on the recent bipartisan agreement to re-open the federal government for three weeks; saying the President should declare a national emergency should Democrats fail to live-up to their end of the bargain.ìCome February the 15th, if the Democrats still say: ëGo to hell on the wall, you get a dollar, thatís it.í They basically tell Trump, ëIím not going to do with you what I did with Bush and Obama,í then I hope he will go the emergency route,î said Graham following the presidentís address.ìWe donít need to shut the government down, we need to secure the border,î Graham said. ìAnd to me, the last best chance to do this win-win is between now and Feb. 15.îThe President presented Congressional leaders with three options Friday: Reach a ìfair dealî by February 15th, face another government shutdown, or prompt Trump to declare a ìnational emergencyî along the southern border.Read the full story at the Washington Examiner.

NANCYíS NIGHTMARE: Pelosi's Poll Numbers PLUNGE After ShutdownA new NBC News / Wall Street Journal Poll shows big trouble for the recently sworn-in Speaker of the House; revealing Nancy Pelosiís approval ratings significantly dropped after the five-week long government shutdown.ìPelosiís approval rate dropped by six points during the 35-day government shutdown, as 47 percent of Americans surveyed rated Pelosi as ëvery negative,í while only 28 percent rated her favorably,î writes the Daily Caller.ìPresident Trumpís standing among Americans remained effectively unchanged even as he presided over the longest partial government shutdown in U.S. history, the latest example of how his unusual brand of politics has resonated with a strong core of supporters,î adds the survey.The poll comes just days before Speaker Pelosi and Congressional Democrats face a hard-deadline to pass a bipartisan budget agreement; setting the stage for another potential shutdown should they fail to fully fund the presidentís border security proposals.Read the full report here.

BREAKING NOW: President Trump Offers Immigration Compromise to Re-Open GovernmentPresident Trump addressed the American people from the White House Saturday afternoon; detailing his new effort to secure the US-Mexico border and re-open the federal government after weeks of a partial government shutdown.ìPresident Trump, in a televised†White House†address Saturday, offered Democrats a compromise package on immigration in an effort to end the nearly monthlong†partial†government shutdown†ó although Democrats dismissed†the olive branch as a ënon-starterí before Trump even spoke,î writes Fox News.ìTrump said that he was prepared to back a three-year extension of protections for 700,000 immigrants†who came to the country illegally as children and were shielded from deportation under the Obama-era Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program, in exchange for the $5.7 billion he has requested for a wall on the southern border. The deal would also extend protections for 300,000 recipients of the Temporary Protected Status (TPS) program ó which protects immigrants from designated countries with conditions†that prevent nationals from returning safely,î adds the author.Read the full report here.

TRUMP UNLEASHED: The President Calls-Out Congressional Democrats with ONE Simple QuestionPresident Trump unloaded on Congressional Democrats Monday morning as the partial government shutdown entered its fifth week; asking the American people how the Democrat-controlled House of Representatives was ìworking outî for the country.ìDemocrats campaigned on working within Washington and ëgetting things done!í How is that working out? #2020TAKEBACKTHEHOUSE,î asked the Commander-in-Chief on social media.Democrats campaigned on working within Washington and ìgetting things done!î How is that working out? #2020TAKEBACKTHEHOUSEó Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 21, 2019The presidentís comments come days after he offered a compromise immigration package to Democratic leadership; saying he was willing to expand DACA coverage to the nationís ëDreamersí in exchange for $5.7 billion in border wall funding.

UNION CONFUSION: White House Plans to Go Ahead with State of the Union Despite PelosiThe White House is reportedly planning to hold the annual State of the Union address as previously planned; ignoring Speaker Nancy Pelosiís insistence the speech be delayed due to the ongoing government shutdown.ìThe White House is still planning to move ahead with next weekís scheduled State of the Union address, but the details remain up in the air after House Speaker†Nancy Pelosi†strongly urged the president to delay the speech or submit it in writing amid the government shutdown fight,î writes Fox News.ìSadly, given the security concerns and unless the government re-opens this week, I suggest that we work together to determine another suitable date after government has re-opened for this address or for you to consider delivering your State of the Union address in writing to Congress on January 29,î†Pelosi wrote in a letter last week.ìWe†are still in a holding pattern,î one senior source said.Read the full report at Fox News.

FUND THE WALL: Trump Refuses to Back Budget Deal without Border Wall FundingPresident Trump told congressional leaders Thursday that he will not sign a budget agreement that fails to include funding for his border wall; increasing the likelihood of a partial ìgovernment shutdownî heading towards Fridayís deadline.ìHouse Speaker Paul Ryan, R-Wis., and House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., told reporters after meeting the president at the White House Thursday afternoon that Trump told them he will not sign the stopgap spending measure,î writes Fox News.ìWhat weíre going to do is go back to the House and work with our members,î Ryan said. ìWe want to keep the government open but we also want†to see an agreement that protects the border. We have very serious concerns about securing our border.îìThe president said what the Senate sent over is just kicking the can down the road,î McCarthy said. ìWe want to solve this problem.îRead the full report at Fox News.

GRAHAM SLAM: Sen. Graham BLASTS ëAbsurd, Petty, and Shamefulí Nancy PelosiSenator Lindsey Graham stopped by ëHannityí Wednesday night to weigh-in on the five-week long government shutdown; saying the President made a ìbrilliant political moveî by moving towards the center on border security.ìHow can anybody look in the eye of a parent who lost a kid to a heroin overdose, and say: ëThis is manufactured?í Or look in the face of an angel mom or dad?î asked Hannity.ìWhat you donít have is clips of Democratic Senators saying this because they know itís a death blow to the party. President Trump made a brilliant political move, and good for the country, to go to the middle,î said Graham.ìThe harder Nancy Pelosi goes left, and the more Trump goes to the middle, weíre going to get this thing solved,î he added.Watch Sen. Graham on ëHannityí above.

PELOSI RESPONDS: Nancy Pelosi Responds to President Trump's Immigration CompromiseSpeaker of the House Nancy Pelosi responded to President Trumpís border security compromise Saturday evening; saying the Commander-in-Chief has ìno sympathyî for those impacted by the partial government shutdown.ìWhat is original in the Presidentís proposal is not good. What is good in the proposal is not original. Democrats will vote next week to add additional border security funding for ports of entry, advanced technology for scanning vehicles for drugs & immigration judges,î posted Pelosi on social media.What is original in the Presidentís proposal is not good. What is good in the proposal is not original. Democrats will vote next week to add additional border security funding for ports of entry, advanced technology for scanning vehicles for drugs & immigration judges.ó Nancy Pelosi (@SpeakerPelosi) January 19, 2019ìWhat we didnít hear from the President was any sympathy for the federal workers who face so much uncertainty because of the chaos of the #TrumpShutdown,î she added.

WATCH LIVE: President Trump Addresses the Nation from the Oval OfficePresident Trump is poised to deliver his first prime-time address from the Oval Office since his inauguration Tuesday evening; speaking directly to the American people about the ongoing government shutdown and the nationís security along the US-Mexico border.The address comes as the second-longest government shutdown in Americaís history enters its third week, with both Democrats and Republicans digging-in on Presidentís signature campaign promise: a physical barrier along the United Statesí southern border.Watch President Trumpís address below:

ëNO CAVE!í: Trump Rallies GOP Legislators to Stay Strong on Border Wall FundingPresident Trump rallied Republican lawmakers on social media Tuesday morning; telling the GOP legislators not to ìcaveî to Democratsí demands that they re-open the federal government without funding for border security.ìWithout a Wall our Country can never have Border or National Security. With a powerful Wall or Steel Barrier, Crime Rates (and Drugs) will go substantially down all over the U.S. The Dems know this but want to play political games. Must finally be done correctly. No Cave!î tweeted the Commander-in-Chief.Without a Wall our Country can never have Border or National Security. With a powerful Wall or Steel Barrier, Crime Rates (and Drugs) will go substantially down all over the U.S. The Dems know this but want to play political games. Must finally be done correctly. No Cave!ó Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 22, 2019The Presidentís post comes as the partial federal government shutdown entered its 32nd day; the longest shutdown in American history.

MEDIA MELTDOWN: CNNís Acosta Slams Trumpís ëChildishí Move to Cancel Pelosiís TripCNN senior White House correspondent Jim Acosta continued his all-out war with the White House Thursday; calling the Presidentís decision to cancel Speaker Pelosiís foreign trip during the government shutdown a ìchildish response.îVideo: Behold the latest Jim @Acosta meltdown! He lost his mind over Trump cancelling Pelosi's overseas trip, calling it a sign that D.C. is 'a playground' and that Trump's being 'childish' and 'not really a serious response' pic.twitter.com/r7MekcGFxró Curtis Houck (@CurtisHouck) January 17, 2019ìOur nationís capital has officially become a playground. Our President has responded in a childish way to the House Speakerís letter; essentially saying the State of the Union be postponed,î said Acosta.ìHeís calling upon the Speaker to join his strong border security movement -as heís calling it- to end the shutdown,î he added.

HANNITY: What is Nancy Pelosi Fighting For?Speaking during his opening monologue on ëHannityí Thursday night; Sean slammed House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for playing ìpetty political gamesî as the partial government shutdown finishes its fifth week.ìHouse Speaker Nancy Pelosi is playing petty political games with the nation, the State of the Union, the President. What is she fighting for? The President is fighting life and death, heís fighting for safety and security,î said Hannity.ìShe refused to compromise on budget negotiationsÖ Sheís been too busy on her luxurious vacationsÖ To even talk to the President -whoís offered dramatic compromises- she has no time for that,î he added.Watch Hannityís opening monologue above.

ITíS ON: President Trump Vows to Deliver State of the Union in Pelosiís House of RepresentativesPresident Trump vowed Wednesday to deliver his annual State of the Union address inside the House of Representatives; saying he will make his speech ìon time, on schedule, and very importantly, on location.îìI will be honoring your invitation, and fulfilling my Constitutional duty, to deliver important information to the people and Congress of the United States of America regarding the State of our Union,î†wrote Trump in a letter to Speaker Pelosi.ìI look forward to seeing you on the evening on January 29th in the Chamber of the House of Representatives. It would be so very sad for our country if the State of the Union were not delivered on time, on schedule, and very importantly, on location!î he added.Last week, Pelosi urged the President to delay his annual address until both parties resolve the five-week long government shutdown.Read the full story at Fox News.

ëWHO CARES?í President Trump Dismisses Ocasio-Cortezí Recent AttacksPresident Trump totally dismissed recent critiques from Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Monday; asking reporters ìwho caresî when pressed on her vicious claims the Commander-in-Chief was an outright racist.The President was speaking from the White House lawn Monday over the ongoing government shutdown when one reporter asked him to weigh-in on the self-described Democratic-Socialistís hateful rhetoric.Trump responds to Ocasio-Cortez calling him a racistReporter: ìMr. President, congresswoman Ocasio-Cortez called you a racistîTrump: ìWho did?îReporter: ìCongresswoman Ocasio-CortezîTrump: ìWho caresî pic.twitter.com/Wh5x6ZXYwbó Ryan Saavedra (@RealSaavedra) January 14, 2019ìMr. President, congresswoman Ocasio-Cortez called you a racist,î yelled one journalist.ìWho cares? Geez,î replied the President.

GRAHAM ON HANNITY: Democrats Oppose Border Wall ëBecause They Want Trump to FailíSen. Lindsey Graham stopped by ëHannityí Wednesday night to weigh-in on the partial government shutdown; saying Democrats ìrefuse to give a dimeî to President Trump simply ìbecause they want him to fail.îìIt makes my blood boil because this is happening time and again. We had people that didnít respect our laws or our sovereignty come to America, commit more crimes, theyíre in custody, then theyíre protected from the laws of the land,î said Hannity.ìThese policies make it more likely that terrorists, drug dealers, and criminals can come to America and have a safe havenÖ Democrats are for border security, except when Trumpís president. Iíve seen them in action. They wonít give a dime to this president because they want him to fail,î fired-back Graham.Watch Sen. Graham on ëHannityí above.

BOBíS REBUKE: Sen. Menendez Slams FOX NEWS for Reporting on Democratsí Puerto Rico VacationSen. Bob Menendez slammed Fox News Tuesday for reporting on congressional Democratsí recent tropical retreat during the ongoing government shutdown; saying the networkís coverage ìwas neither fair nor balancedî in covering the lawmakersí Puerto Rican visit.ìYou could have had hours and hours and hours of meetings and you chose one thing for an hour,î said the legislator after an employee of the network posted in image of Menendez on the beach as thousands of federal workers went unpaid.Sen. Menendez lashes out at Fox News for beach photo: 'You're neither fair nor balanced' https://t.co/IORcA5wAOmó The Washington Times (@WashTimes) January 15, 2019ìYou guys are not fair,î said the Senator. ìYouíre neither fair nor balanced. So, thank you.îRead the full report at the Washington Times.

MORE CRACKS? Growing Chorus of Democrats Urge Pelosi to Negotiate on Border WallA growing list of centrist Democrats are calling-on Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi to negotiate with the White House on border security; saying she must work towards ending the five-week long government shutdown.ìDemocratic leaders†in Congress say they have no interest in making a deal with†President Trump†to end the government shutdown if it includes new money for his border wall,î writes Fox News.ìBut cracks within the Trump resistance are starting to show, with Democratic lawmakers and influential liberal opinion makers imploring House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer to at least meet Trump at the negotiating table. Some are even arguing they should agree to†border wall funds,î adds Fox.ìGive Trump the money,î Minnesota Democratic Rep. Collin Peterson†said on local radio†Tuesday. ìIíd give him the whole thingÖand put strings on it so you make sure he puts the wall where it needs to be. Why are we fighting over this? Weíre going to build that wall anyway, at some time.îRead the full report at Fox News.

TRUMP TO TEXAS: The President Plans to Hold His First Political Rally of 2019 in EL PASOPresident Trump announced this week his plans to hold his first political rally of 2019 in the border city of El Paso, Texas in the coming days; highlighting the escalating crisis taking place along the porous southern border with Mexico.ìThe rally, scheduled for Monday, comes amid ongoing negotiations between Trump and congressional Democrats as the president tries to secure more than $5 billion in funding for his long-promised border wall,î reports The Hill.ìThe border city of El Paso, Texas, used to have extremely high rates of violent crime†ó one of the highest in the country, and considered one of our†nationís most dangerous cities,î said the President during his State of the Union address Tuesday. ìNow, with a powerful barrier in place, El Paso is one of our safest cities.îThe event will take place just days before a February 15th deadline, when congressional leaders must pass a bipartisan budget agreement that funds the Presidentís border wall or face another potential government shutdown.Read the full report here.
